actor_awards.notes: Despite his legendary status, Lugosi never received an Academy Award nomination. Martin Landau won an Oscar for portraying him in the 1994 biopic 'Ed Wood'.

filmography.title: Dracula
filmography.role_description: The ancient vampire Count who travels from Transylvania to London to prey upon the innocent, establishing the definitive cinematic vampire.
filmography.plot: The ancient vampire Count Dracula arrives in England and begins to prey upon the virtuous young Mina.

filmography.title: White Zombie
filmography.role_description: A sinister voodoo master in Haiti who turns a young woman into a zombie to satisfy a plantation owner's obsession.
filmography.plot: A young man turns to a witch doctor to lure the woman he loves away from her fianc√©, but instead turns her into a zombie slave.

filmography.title: Murders in the Rue Morgue
filmography.role_description: A mad carnival scientist who kidnaps women to inject them with gorilla blood in an attempt to prove an evolutionary theory.
filmography.plot: A mad scientist seeks to mix human and ape blood to create a mate for his talking sideshow gorilla.

filmography.title: Island of Lost Souls
filmography.role_description: The hairy, beast-man leader who preaches the law of Dr. Moreau to the other hybrids: 'Are we not men?'
filmography.plot: A mad doctor conducts ghastly genetic experiments on a remote island, creating a race of half-human, half-animal hybrids.

filmography.title: The Black Cat
filmography.role_description: A vengeful psychiatrist who returns from a prisoner-of-war camp to confront the Satan-worshipping architect who stole his wife.
filmography.plot: American honeymooners in Hungary are trapped in the home of a Satan-worshipping priest when the bride is taken there for medical help.

filmography.title: The Raven
filmography.role_description: A brilliant but maniacal plastic surgeon obsessed with Edgar Allan Poe who tortures his guests with devices inspired by Poe's stories.
filmography.plot: A brilliant surgeon obsessed with Edgar Allan Poe saves the life of a beautiful dancer and goes mad when he can't have her.

filmography.title: Mark of the Vampire
filmography.role_description: A vampire actor hired by a police inspector to stage a supernatural hoax and catch a murderer.
filmography.plot: A police inspector sets an elaborate trap for a murderer using a troupe of actors posing as vampires.

filmography.title: The Invisible Ray
filmography.role_description: A benevolent scientist who tries to help a colleague poisoned by a radioactive meteor, only to become a victim himself.
filmography.plot: A scientist becomes murderous after discovering a new element that gives him the touch of death.

filmography.title: Son of Frankenstein
filmography.role_description: A broken-necked, gravel-voiced blacksmith who survived a hanging and now uses the Monster as a tool for revenge.
filmography.plot: One of Frankenstein's sons finds his father's monster in a coma and revives him, only to find out he is controlled by Ygor.

filmography.title: Ninotchka
filmography.role_description: The stern Soviet official who dispatches Ninotchka to Paris; a rare non-horror role in a major studio comedy.
filmography.plot: A stern Russian woman sent to Paris on official business finds herself attracted to a man who represents everything she is supposed to detest.

filmography.title: The Human Monster
filmography.role_description: An insurance broker who runs a home for the blind as a front to murder elderly men for their insurance money.
filmography.plot: A madman collects insurance on the men he murders, dumping their bodies into the Thames.
filmography.awards: First British Horror Film with 'H' Rating

filmography.title: Black Friday
filmography.role_description: A ruthless gangster who hunts for hidden money, unaware that his rival's brain has been transplanted into a professor.
filmography.plot: A brain surgeon transplants part of a gangster's brain into a dying professor to save his life, with disastrous results.

filmography.title: The Devil Bat
filmography.role_description: A mad scientist who breeds giant bats and trains them to kill anyone wearing a specific shaving lotion.
filmography.plot: A mad scientist develops an aftershave lotion that causes his gigantic bats to kill anyone who wears it.

filmography.title: You'll Find Out
filmography.role_description: A turban-wearing mystic who conspires against an heiress in a spooky mansion filled with musical band members.
filmography.plot: Kay Kyser and his band are hired to play at a birthday party in a spooky mansion, where they uncover a plot against the heiress.

filmography.title: The Wolf Man
filmography.role_description: The fortune-telling gypsy who is actually a werewolf, passing the curse onto Larry Talbot.
filmography.plot: A practical man returns to his homeland, is attacked by a creature of folklore, and infected with a horrific disease his disciplined mind tells him cannot possibly exist.

filmography.title: The Ghost of Frankenstein
filmography.role_description: Reprising his role as the broken-necked blacksmith who manipulates a new Frankenstein son into transplanting his brain into the Monster.
filmography.plot: Ygor resurrects Frankenstein's Monster and brings him to the original doctor's second son for help.

filmography.title: The Corpse Vanishes
filmography.role_description: A mad botanist who kidnaps brides on their wedding day to extract glandular fluids to keep his aging wife young.
filmography.plot: A mad scientist kidnaps young brides to extract their glandular fluids to keep his wife young.

filmography.title: Bowery at Midnight
filmography.role_description: A psychology professor who leads a double life running a Bowery soup kitchen as a front for a criminal ring.
filmography.plot: A kindly soup kitchen operator uses his establishment as a front for a criminal gang and a place to dispose of bodies.

filmography.title: Frankenstein Meets the Wolf Man
filmography.role_description: Lugosi finally plays the Monster, though the role was famously cut, leaving the creature blind and mute without explanation.
filmography.plot: Larry Talbot (The Wolf Man) travels to Castle Frankenstein to find a cure, where he finds the Monster frozen in ice.

filmography.title: The Return of the Vampire
filmography.role_description: A vampire (essentially Dracula) who is unearthed during the London Blitz and seeks revenge on the family of the man who staked him.
filmography.plot: A vampire is unearthed in London during World War II and seeks revenge on the family that destroyed him.

filmography.title: The Body Snatcher
filmography.role_description: A dim-witted servant who attempts to blackmail a grave robber and pays the ultimate price.
filmography.plot: A ruthless doctor and his young prize student find themselves continually harassed by their murderous supplier of illegal cadavers.

filmography.title: Zombies on Broadway
filmography.role_description: A mad scientist on a Caribbean island who creates zombies, pursued by two bumbling press agents.
filmography.plot: Two press agents travel to a Caribbean island to find a real zombie for a nightclub opening.

filmography.title: Scared to Death
filmography.role_description: A hypnotist involved in a tangled web of murder and mystery, narrated by a dead woman in the morgue.
filmography.plot: From a slab in the morgue, a dead woman tells the bizarre story of how she reached her predicament.

filmography.title: Abbott and Costello Meet Frankenstein
filmography.role_description: Lugosi reprises his most famous role for the last time in a major studio film, playing it straight against the comic duo.
filmography.plot: Two hapless freight handlers find themselves encountering Dracula, the Frankenstein Monster, and the Wolf Man.

filmography.title: Bride of the Monster
filmography.role_description: An aging mad scientist living in a swamp who attempts to create a race of atomic supermen.
filmography.plot: A mad scientist and his hulking assistant capture people to use in atomic super-race experiments.

filmography.title: Plan 9 from Outer Space
filmography.role_description: Silent footage of Lugosi filmed just before his death was used to create this character in Ed Wood's infamous sci-fi epic.
filmography.plot: Aliens resurrect the dead on Earth to stop humanity from creating a doomsday weapon.
